January 1, 2007 was a Monday. In 2007, how many Fridays are there?
inference:
January 1, 2007 was a Monday.
The days of the week repeat every 7 days.
January 2007 has 31 days.
The days of the week will be:
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, ...
So, the days of the week repeat every 7 days.
In January, the 8th day is Monday. The 15th day is Monday, the 22nd day is Monday and the 29th day is Monday.
January has 31 days.
The first day of January is Monday.
The days of the week repeat in a cycle of 7 days.
So, the 8th is Monday, the 15th is Monday, the 22nd is Monday, the 29th is Monday.
So, in January, the days of the week repeat every 7 days.
The days are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, ...
The 8th is Monday, the 15th is Monday, the 22nd is Monday, the 29th is Monday.
The Fridays are the 5th, 12th, 19th, 26th.
January has 31 days.
In January 2007, the days of the week are:
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, ...
The first day is Monday.
The days are:
1-Monday
2-Tuesday
3-Wednesday
4-Thursday
5-Friday
6-Saturday
7-Sunday
8-Monday
9-Tuesday
10-Wednesday
...
The first Friday is the 5th.
The second Friday is the 12th.
The third Friday is the 19th.
The fourth Friday is the 26th.
There are 4 Fridays in January 2007.
In 2007, January 1st was a Monday.
2007 is not a leap year.
January 2007 has 31 days.
The first Friday is the 5th.
The second Friday is the 12th.
The third Friday is the 19th.
The fourth Friday is the 26th.
There are 4 Fridays in January 2007.

Final Answer: $\boxed{4}$
ground_truth: There were 365 days in 2007, and since $364=7\cdot52$, there were $52$ full weeks and $1$ more day in the year. So there were $\boxed{52}$ Fridays.

inference:
Since January 1, 2007, was a Monday, the Fridays in January 2007 occur on the 5th, 12th, 19th, and 26th.  There are 4 Fridays in January 2007.

$\boxed{4}$
ground_truth: There were 365 days in 2007, and since $364=7\cdot52$, there were $52$ full weeks and $1$ more day in the year. So there were $\boxed{52}$ Fridays.
